bibl.title: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 4, 1927

div1.p: Kibler requests information on Walter Reed for a newspaper article relative to the dedication of Walter Reed's birthplace.

div1.head: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 4, 1927
div1.opener:
NEWPORT NEWS, VA.
P. O. BOX 470,
August 4, 1927.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Blue Ridge Summitt,
Pennsylvania.
Dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Let me thank you for the information given. I am particular about
that type of data that is not so familiar to the general public, such as has been
frequently given in newspaper articles on Dr. Reed's life. So I wonder if your son
in Rhode Island could supply me, in some way, with the family history and other data
he has? If he will say what it would cost a have typed copy made for me--in brief
form of the more essential and interesting matters, I shall be pleaed.

Some time ago Mr. Davidson made tentative arrangements with Dr. Jones for me
to collaborate with me, and I with him, in preparing a booklet on the Life and works
of Dr. Reed. Of course, circumstances as they develop, if favorable, will determine
this matter as a definite proposition.

I think I can get the book you mention from Dr. Jones. What I would like
also, iss a bibliography of magazine articles on Dr. Reed's Life and achievements; I
have several subjects, but not enough to satisfy me.

Dr. Jones advised me recently that about August 20th, BELROI would be ready
for “pilgrims” to visit. I will get further particulars about any special dedication
program. I want to supply Washington Star with a “story” on this event, as the editor
has indicated to me what he wants. It would be “too bad” if you could not be present
at this time, as you desire!

I have written to Dr. Reed's brother at Blackstone for the information he can
also supply me.
